properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heavy snow possible tonight. Snowfall may become heavy at times for a few hours overnight with many areas receiving up to 10 cm by Wednesday morning. This snow is a result of a low pressure system from the Southern Plains States that will spread across parts of Northwestern Ontario tonight. The snow will quickly end Wednesday morning as the low pressure area races across Northeastern Ontario into Quebec. Hazardous winter driving conditions are expected tonight. Untreated roads may become snow covered and slippery. Low visibility in heavy snow may also be an issue to deal with. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-11T17:28:59-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-11T01:29:59-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2975720283.2020
Area: Gull Bay - Black Sturgeon Lake, Upsala - Raith, Atikokan - Shebandowan - Quetico Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wintry mix of precipitation on tap tonight. Snow accumulations of 5 to 10 cm, along with ice pellets and a risk of freezing rain are possible tonight. Precipitation has arrived as expected with a mixture of snow, ice pellets and brief freezing rain expected to continue during the overnight hours. Precipitation will transition completely over to snow by early Wednesday morning the taper off later in morning. Driving conditions may deteriorate tonight. Untreated roads may become icy and slippery. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-11T17:59:06-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-11T05:21:06-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2389886737.2020
Area: Marathon - Schreiber
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Brief freezing rain possible tonight into early Wednesday. Periods of rain will continue tonight and may change briefly to freezing rain near midnight or overnight as colder air from the north filters into parts of the region. Temperatures will drop to near the zero degree mark. The risk for freezing rain will end Wednesday morning as the low pressure system responsible for the precipitation races across Northeastern Ontario into Quebec. Driving conditions may deteriorate tonight. Untreated roads may become icy and slippery. Freezing rain warnings may be issued as necessary. . ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-11T17:59:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-11T03:04:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0376927711.2020
Area: Wawa - Pukaskwa Park, Little Abitibi - Kesagami Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow continues into this morning. Snow, heavy at times, will continue into this morning before ending by noon across the area. Total snowfall amounts up to 15 cm in many areas are expected. Hazardous winter driving conditions will continue this morning. Untreated roads will be snow covered and slippery. Very low to near zero visibility in bursts of heavy snow is possible. ### Rapidly accumulating snow will make travel difficult. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-11T17:59:03-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-11T13:53:03-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0439328850.2020
Area: Nakina - Aroland - Pagwa, Geraldton - Longlac - Caramat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow continues in the Cypress Hills. While much of southwestern Saskatchewan will see light snow gradually taper off today, the Cypress Hills will continue to see moderate to heavy snow sustained by a northwest wind. A further 5 to 15 cm of snow is likely over the Cypress Hills today. Travellers should be prepared for poor road conditions in these regions. The snow will finally come to an end this evening as the winds diminish. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-12T02:33:26-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-11T10:34:26-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4181858071.2020

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 15 cm is expected. Snowfall is expected to be heaviest in areas over and just to the north of the Cypress Hills. The area of 10-15 cm of snow is expected to stay south and southeast of the city of Medicine Hat. Medicine Hat is expected to see a further 2 cm this morning. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-11-11T19:59:06-00:00

properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain continuing into this morning. A band of freezing rain across the region will move out this morning as a low pressure system responsible for the precipitation races across Northeastern Ontario into Quebec. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Maximum gusts: westerly 70 km/h, except 100 in the Canada Bay area. Time span: overnight tonight until Thursday afternoon. Remarks: A period of strong southwesterly to westerly winds is expected, with the highest gusts anticipated to occur in the Canada Bay area. Winds will gradually diminish Thursday afternoon as they shift to the northwest. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-11-12T06:16:50-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-11-11T14:17:50-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2688528298.2020

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A mixture of snow and ice pellets along with brief freezing rain will move out of the region by noon as a low pressure system races across northeastern Ontario into northwestern Quebec. Total snowfall and ice pellet amounts of 2 to 5 cm are expected. Surfaces such as roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain is expected or occurring. Locations: Churchill Falls to Eagle River. Time span: this afternoon into this evening. Remarks: Snow will change to freezing rain near noon in Churchill Falls and Churchill Valley, and this afternoon in Goose Bay and Eagle River. Freezing rain will change to periods of rain this evening as the temperature rises above zero. Motorists travelling the Trans-Labrador Highway will experience icy road conditions during this period. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
